about.title: About Us
about.intro: The Archaeological Information System of the Czech Republic (AIS CR) was established as a long-term project of the Czech Academy of Sciences in Prague and Brno. Since 2016, it has been part of the Roadmap for Large Research Infrastructures of the Czech Republic. It is thus long-term financially supported by the Ministry of Education, Youth and Sports of the Czech Republic.
about.quote: The goal of AIS CR is to professionally manage, make accessible, and permanently preserve data from archaeological field excavations from the territory of the Czech Republic and build a digital ecosystem for Czech archaeology.
about.feature1: We cover archaeological data from the earliest excavations in the 19th century to currently ongoing research.
about.feature2: We preserve physical and digital records and make them accessible through online tools, in context and without unnecessary barriers. We thus create a trustworthy digital repository.
about.feature3: We digitally process documents collected since 1919 and continuously oversee the quality of records and documentation of currently ongoing archaeological excavations.
about.feature4: We improve record quality by linking related documents, supplementing missing older data, and building authority lists of archaeological excavations and sites.
about.feature5: We follow the latest trends in digital data management (digital curation) and support the implementation of technological innovations.
about.feature6: We bring standards based on internationally recognized FAIR principles and interdisciplinary research data management environments to the Czech archaeological community.
about.feature7: We recognize the diversity of our user base – from professional and amateur communities through public administration to the general public – and adapt the form and focus of our tools accordingly.
about.feature8: We strive for AIS CR data to be part of the linked web, i.e., standardized and technically compatible with other information systems, and to be discoverable internationally.
about.feature9: We maintain an expert team that manages data, develops application tools, and develops the necessary digital skills of our users.
about.feature10: We help understand the role of archaeology in society and purposefully strengthen the use of research results in practice.
about.whyQuote: Unique and irreplaceable archaeological data deserve professional care – that's why AIS CR exists.
about.whyExplanation: Most field archaeological excavations use destructive methods and usually take place at future construction sites. Without conducting the excavation, there would be a risk that relics of the past – remnants of settlements, burial grounds, and other manifestations of human activity in the past – would be irreversibly destroyed during construction. Only the finds and documentation obtained during archaeological excavations remain. Museums care for the finds. We care for the records and data.
about.whoQuote: We are an expert team with deep knowledge of the field – data is safe with AIS CR.
about.whoExplanation: AIS CR is coordinated by the Institute of Archaeology of the CAS, Brno (ARÚB Archive, where datasets and archival fund for Moravia and Czech Silesia are managed) together with the Institute of Archaeology of the CAS, Prague (Department of Information Resources and Landscape Archaeology ARÚ with management for the territory of Bohemia).
about.executiveDescription: Balanced partnership management of the project is ensured by the Executive Board of AIS CR, in which two members from each institution are represented.
about.advisoryTitle: Scientific Advisory Board of AIS CR
about.advisoryDescription: Professional advice in the field of research support, technical development, and user strategies is provided by the Scientific Advisory Board of AIS CR, composed of internationally recognized experts in archaeology, digital cultural heritage, and research infrastructures.
about.fundingIntro: The main source of funding for AIS CR is support for large research infrastructures included in the national roadmap. This long-term funding is secured based on thorough international evaluation and is provided by the Ministry of Education, Youth and Sports in multi-year cycles since 2016 (projects: LM2015080, LM2018134, LM2023031).
about.fundingEu: Investment costs of AIS CR are complementarily covered from EU structural funds in projects:
about.fundingProject1: Archaeological Information System of the Czech Republic - second generation (OP VVV; EF16_013/0001439)
about.fundingProject2: Archaeological Information System of the Czech Republic - renewal and expansion of hardware capacities (OP JAK; EH23_015/0008167)
about.fundingMore: Other related projects and funding sources can be found here.
about.partnersIntro: AIS CR actively cooperates with more than a hundred organizations authorized to conduct archaeological excavations in the Czech Republic. It has agreements with them on the submission of the archaeological map of the Czech Republic and also license agreements with most, enabling sharing of archival documents through the Digital Archive AMČR.

terms.title: Terms of Use of AIS CR
terms.intro: AIS CR tools are available free of charge and openly to everyone, provided these basic conditions arising from the law are met (especially §32, paragraph 4, Act No. 130/2002 Coll., on support for research and development).
terms.usageTitle: Use of AIS CR in Outputs
terms.usageImportance: This information is essential for reporting the results of AIS CR infrastructure activities to funding providers.
terms.obligation1Text: Users are obliged to state in the usual manner the use of AIS CR infrastructure in their outputs, always with a specific reference to the data or tools used.
terms.obligation2Text: When entering outputs into the Register of Information on Results (RIV), when using AIS CR, it is mandatory in the VVI field (Large Research Infrastructures) - infrastructure location of AIS CR, i.e., to select from the Register of Large Research Infrastructures the item "AIS CR" with the highest serial number marked with a Roman numeral (e.g., "AIS CR III").
terms.obligation3Text: We will be very grateful if you inform us about the published output through this short form. This will significantly help us fulfill our reporting obligations.
terms.openAccessIntro: Data made available in AIS CR tools are published in accordance with the open access policy to the maximum extent possible.
terms.licenseText: Unless otherwise stated, data and content of AIS CR websites are provided under the CC BY-NC 4.0 license (Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial 4.0 International).
terms.licenseConditions: This means they can be freely used provided:
terms.licenseCondition1: reference to the source is provided according to the recommended procedure;
terms.licenseException1: materials that are in the public domain;
terms.licenseException2: cases that fall under exceptions or limitations of copyright law.
terms.accessControlIntro: Data openness is generally limited only by:
terms.accessControlLimit1: legal limits (e.g., copyright, personal data protection);
terms.accessControlLimit2: needs for protection of archaeological heritage in the landscape.
terms.accessControlText: For these reasons, access to some parts of AIS CR requires access through an AMČR user account with assignment of a user role.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.q1: I am interested in archaeological research. Where can I find information about it?
faq.a1: Information about archaeological research can be found in the Archaeological Map of the Czech Republic (AMČR). The system contains a database of all registered archaeological activities, including their location, chronological classification, and basic results. You can search by locality, period, or type of research.
faq.q2: Archaeology is my hobby, and I want to cooperate as an amateur in archaeological research. Is this possible?
faq.a2: Yes, it is possible through the AMČR-PAS system (Portal for Amateur Collaborators). This system allows for the registration of volunteers, recording of finds, and coordination of cooperation between amateurs and professional archaeologists. It is necessary to follow legal procedures and cooperate with authorized archaeological organizations.
faq.q3: Where are areas with archaeological finds located in the Czech Republic?
faq.a3: Archaeological finds are located practically throughout the entire territory of the Czech Republic. The density of finds varies by region and historical settlement. Most finds are recorded in areas with long-term continuous settlement, such as fertile lowlands and river valleys. Precise information can be found in the AMČR map applications.
faq.q4: In what area is archaeological research required? And is it mandatory at all?
faq.a4: Archaeological research is mandatory according to Act No. 20/1987 Coll., on State Heritage Care, in areas with archaeological finds during construction activities. The obligation applies to the entire territory of the Czech Republic, with the intensity of research depending on the archaeological potential of the specific locality. Research is carried out only by authorized archaeological organizations.
faq.q5: Do I always have an obligation to submit a notification of a construction plan or other terrain intervention according to the heritage law? What is the best way?
faq.a5: Yes, according to § 22 of Act No. 20/1987 Coll., it is mandatory to notify construction plans and terrain interventions to the relevant archaeological institute. The simplest way is electronic submission through the AMČR portal, where you will find forms and instructions. Notification must be submitted at least 30 days before the start of work.
faq.q6: I am planning construction and looking for an institution that can carry out archaeological research. How should I proceed?
faq.a6: Use the Map of Authorized Archaeological Organizations (Map OAO), where you will find an overview of all organizations authorized to carry out archaeological research in specific regions. Each organization has a defined territorial scope and contact details. We recommend contacting multiple organizations to compare offers.
faq.q7: Can I view archaeological finds from research online?
faq.a7: Yes, many archaeological finds are available online through the AMČR Digital Archive and the 3D Library. These platforms contain photographic documentation, 3D models of selected artifacts, and detailed descriptions of finds. Access to some materials may be restricted due to cultural heritage protection.
faq.q8: Do I need to state anywhere that I used AIS CR in my work?
faq.a8: Yes, when using data or tools from AIS CR in publications, research, or presentations, it is necessary to provide proper citation. This helps track the impact of the system and ensures research transparency. Specific citation formats can be found in the documentation of individual tools.
faq.q9: Can archaeological sites be visited? And is there a selection or map of recommended ones?
faq.a9: Some archaeological sites are publicly accessible, while others are protected, and visits are restricted. We recommend using the Archaeological Atlas, which contains information about publicly accessible sites, including practical visiting information. Always respect protective measures and site manager instructions.
faq.q10: Where can I find out what's new in AIS CR or what you're planning?
faq.a10: Current information about news and planned features can be found on our blog, in the newsletter, and on social media. We regularly publish articles about new features, system updates, and upcoming projects. You can also subscribe to our newsletter.

amcrMap.title: Archaeological Map of the Czech Republic (AMČR)
amcrMap.content:
The Archaeological Map of the Czech Republic is a comprehensive information system used for recording, documenting, and presenting archaeological research and finds in the Czech Republic. The system provides archaeologists, conservators, and the general public with access to current information about archaeological sites, research, and finds.

Main functions of AMČR:
• Recording of archaeological research and activities
• Documentation of archaeological finds and situations
• Map display of archaeological sites
• Management of archaeological documentation
• Support for field work of archaeologists
• Access to archaeological data for research purposes

The system is constantly updated and expanded with new functions according to the needs of the archaeological community.

digitalArchive.title: Digital Archive of AMČR
digitalArchive.content:
The Digital Archive of AMČR represents a vast repository of digitized archaeological documents, photographs, plans, and other materials related to archaeological research in the Czech Republic.

Contents of the digital archive:
• Archaeological reports and documentation
• Photographs from archaeological research
• Plans and drawings of archaeological situations
• Field diaries and records
• Catalogs of finds
• Historical archaeological documents

The archive is continuously supplemented with new materials and provides researchers and the public with unique access to the archaeological heritage of the Czech Republic.

oaoMap.title: Map of Authorized Archaeological Organizations (Map OAO)
oaoMap.content:
The Map OAO provides an overview of authorized archaeological organizations in the Czech Republic, their scope, and contact details.

Functions of the OAO map:
• Display of the territorial scope of archaeological organizations
• Contact details for individual organizations
• Information on the specialization of organizations
• Assistance in finding the right organization for a specific location
• Current overview of changes in authorizations

The map is an important tool for coordinating archaeological activities in the Czech Republic.

amcrPas.title: AMČR-PAS - Portal for Amateur Collaborators and Registration of Individual Finds
amcrPas.content:
AMČR-PAS is a specialized platform designed for recording archaeological finds discovered by amateur collaborators and the metal detecting community.

Main functions of PAS:
• Registration of individual archaeological finds
• Cooperation with amateur archaeological collaborators
• Verification and validation of reported finds
• Educational materials for metal detectorists
• Coordination between amateur and professional archaeological communities
• Protection of archaeological heritage through cooperation

The system supports legal and responsible metal detecting activities in accordance with archaeological legislation.

library3d.title: 3D Library
library3d.content:
The 3D Library is an innovative platform for presenting and archiving three-dimensional models of archaeological finds and sites.

Contents of the library:
• 3D models of archaeological artifacts
• Virtual reconstructions of archaeological situations
• Interactive viewing of finds
• Measurement and analysis of 3D objects
• Educational 3D materials
• Virtual exhibitions of archaeological finds

The library uses the latest technologies for digitizing and presenting archaeological heritage.

amcrApi.title: AMČR API
amcrApi.content:
The AMČR API provides programmatic access to the data of the Archaeological Map of the Czech Republic for developers and researchers.

API capabilities:
• Access to archaeological data in a structured form
• Integration with external applications and systems
• Automated queries and analyses
• Real-time access to current data
• Support for various data formats (JSON, XML, GeoJSON)
• Documentation and usage examples

The API enables the creation of specialized applications and analyses based on archaeological data.

documentation.title: AMČR Documentation
documentation.content:
Comprehensive documentation of the AMČR system provides detailed information on the use of all functions and tools.

Contents of the documentation:
• User manuals for individual modules
• Technical documentation for system administrators
• Guides for beginners
• Advanced functions and tips
• FAQ - frequently asked questions
• Video tutorials and training materials
• Contacts for technical support

The documentation is regularly updated according to system development and user needs.

atlas.title: Archaeological Atlas of the Czech Republic (Atlas)
atlas.subtitle: Other components of AIS CR
atlas.content:
The Archaeological Atlas of the Czech Republic is a specialized tool for visualizing and presenting archaeological monuments directly in the landscape.

Main functions of the atlas:
• Map display of archaeological monuments
• Tourist routes to archaeological sites
• Photographs and reconstructions of monuments
• Description of historical contexts
• Information on site accessibility
• Educational and popularization content

The atlas connects archaeology with tourism and makes archaeological heritage accessible to the general public.

teater.title: Thesaurus of Archaeological Terminology (TEATER)
teater.content:
TEATER is a multilingual dictionary of archaeological terminology for Czech, English, and German professional communication.

Contents of the thesaurus:
• Standardized archaeological terminology
• Multilingual translations of specialized terms
• Hierarchical structure of concepts
• Definitions and explanations of terms
• Links between related concepts
• Support for cataloging and documentation

The thesaurus ensures uniform terminology in Czech archaeology and facilitates international cooperation.

prahaArch.title: Archaeological Prague
prahaArch.content:
Archaeological Prague is a specialized portal dedicated to the archaeological heritage of the capital city of the Czech Republic.

Contents of the portal:
• Recording of archaeological research in Prague
• Database of archaeological finds from Prague
• History of archaeological research in the metropolis
• Maps of archaeological sites
• Virtual tours of significant finds
• Information about Prague archaeological institutions

The portal documents the rich archaeological heritage of Prague from prehistory to modern times.

arch14cz.title: Czech Archaeological Radiocarbon Database (Arch14CZ)
arch14cz.content:
Arch14CZ collects and makes available radiocarbon dating data from archaeological contexts in the Czech Republic.

Contents of the database:
• Radiocarbon data from Czech sites
• Calibration and statistical processing of data
• Link to archaeological contexts
• Chronological models
• Tools for 14C data analysis
• Comparison with European databases

The database contributes to precise dating of archaeological situations and research of prehistoric and medieval settlements.

archeologieOnline.title: Archaeology Online
archeologieOnline.content:
Archaeology Online is a web portal dedicated to popularizing archaeology and presenting current archaeological discoveries.

Contents of the portal:
• Current news from archaeological research
• Articles about significant discoveries
• Interviews with archaeologists
• Popularization texts about archaeology
• Photo galleries from research
• Calendar of archaeological events

The portal makes archaeological knowledge accessible to the general public in an understandable and attractive form.

thanados.title: THANADOS
thanados.content:
THANADOS is an international database system for recording and analyzing archaeological data on burial sites.

System functions:
• Recording of grave units and burial grounds
• Anthropological data on the buried
• Cataloging of grave goods
• Spatial analysis of burial grounds
• Statistical processing of funerary data
• International description standards

The system enables comprehensive study of burial customs across time and space.

github.title: Source code of tools on GitHub
github.content:
The GitHub repository provides access to the source code of AIS CR tools and applications.

Repository contents:
• Open source code of applications
• Documentation for developers
• Issue tracking and bug management
• Possibility of community contributions
• Versioning and change history
• Open source license

Open access supports transparency, collaboration, and further development of the system.

zenodo.title: Documents for download on Zenodo
zenodo.content:
The Zenodo archive contains publications, datasets, and documentation related to AIS CR.

Available materials:
• Scientific publications about the system
• Technical documentation
• User manuals
• Data sets for research
• Presentations and training materials
• DOI identifiers for citability

The archive ensures long-term availability and citability of project outputs.

otherTools.title: Other tools and applications
otherTools.content:
A collection of other tools and aids for archaeological work and research.

Available tools:
• Mobile applications for field work
• Forms and documentation templates
• Data conversion tools
• Plugins for GIS software
• Scripts for automation
• Guides and best practices

The tools facilitate the daily work of archaeologists and improve the quality of documentation.
